content: next st decrease chain 1 turn 3 st fo back make the back of the hood starting at the top row 1 chain 5 single_crochet in second chain from hook single_crochet in each remaining chain chain 1 turn 4 st row 2 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet into next 2 st 2 single_crochet in next st chain 1 turn 6 st row 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet into next 4 st 2 single_crochet in next st chain 1 turn 8 st row 4 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet into next 6 st 2 single_crochet in next st chain 1 turn 10 st row 5 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet into next 8 st 2 single_crochet in next st chain 1 turn 12 st 7 row 6 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet into next 10 st 2 single_crochet in next st chain 1 turn 14 st row 7 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet into next 12 st 2 single_crochet in next st chain 1 turn 16 st row 8 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet into next 14 st 2 single_crochet in next st chain 1 turn 18 st row 9 - 11 single_crochet into each st chain 1 turn 18 st row 12 decrease single_crochet into next 14 st decrease chain 1 turn 16 st row 13 decrease single_crochet into next 12 st decrease chain 1 turn 14 st row 14 decrease single_crochet into next 10 st decrease chain 1 turn 12 st row 15 decrease single_crochet into next 8 st decrease chain 1 turn 10 st row 16 decrease single_crochet into next 6 st decrease chain 1 turn 8 st row 17 decrease 2 times single_crochet into next 4 st chain 1 turn 6 st row 18 decrease single_crochet into next 2 st decrease chain 1 turn 4 st row 19 decrease single_crochet into next 2 st 3 st do not fo you are now facing the right side sew the front and back together leaving holes for the ears over- sew around the face hole to neaten it a bit pick up the yarn where you finished row 19 and slip-stitch around the bottom edge of the hood front and back for neatness you can also do a few large stitches with the brown yarn to make it look like the stitches on the real thing neaten up any remaining ends of yarn put on wicket s head if you have any questions about this pattern please come to http //lucyravenscar blogspot com/ or http //www ravelry com/patterns/library/wicket-the-ewok 8
